Key Arguments: The Australian Press Council supports the exclusion of professional news content from the scope of the proposed Bill.
The definition of 'news content' in the draft Bill is too narrow and could lead to confusion and compliance issues.
User comments on news source-owned platforms should be exempt from misinformation criteria to protect freedom of expression.
The additional requirement for editorial independence in the definition of professional news content is unnecessary and could interfere with news reporting.
There should be a mechanism to verify claims of compliance with professional standards by news sources.
Main Themes: Definition and scope of news content
User comments and freedom of expression
Verification of compliance with professional standards
Notable Quotes: The Press Council supports the proposal that professional news content will not be within the scope of the proposed Bill.

The Press Council believes the simplest means of addressing this issue is by excluding from the Billâ€™s coverage all material published by a news source that meets the requirements of professional news content.
News sources should be granted full autonomy to moderate public discussion and debate.
